wikipedia_page.main: Brian Woledge, FBA (born August 16, 1904 in London - died June 3, 2002, in Stoke Mandeville, Buckinghamshire), a scholar of Old French language and literature, was Fielden Professor of French at University College London from 1939 to 1971.

response: Although UCL was among the first universities to admit women on the same terms as men, in 1878, the college's senior common room, the Housman Room, remained men-only until 1969. After two unsuccessful attempts, a motion was passed that ended segregation by sex at UCL. This was achieved by Brian Woledge (Fielden Professor of French at UCL from 1939 to 1971) and David Colquhoun, at that time a young lecturer in pharmacology.
* Brian Woledge, Fielden Professor of French from 1939–71 at University College London
*Brian Woledge, 97, English scholar of medieval French language and literature.
*  Brian Woledge, L'atre périlleux, roman de la Table Ronde, Paris, Champion (Les classiques français du Moyen Âge, 76), 1936.
